creator: vijay.palakkat@morganstanley.com
text:
In my JAVA Code, I am trying to parse a large XML file using a DOM parser. It 
keeps giving outOfMemory error on a solaris machine. When i run it on a linux 
machine, it gives me the following exceptions. When i remove some of the 
elements from the XML message, it parses it fine.
Can you please help me fix this problem.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.StackOverflowError
        at org.apache.xerces.validators.common.Grammar.buildSyntaxTree
(Grammar.java:771)
        at org.apache.xerces.validators.common.Grammar.buildSyntaxTree
(Grammar.java:771)
        at org.apache.xerces.validators.common.Grammar.buildSyntaxTree
(Grammar.java:771)

creator: mrglavas@ca.ibm.com
text:
XmlCommons isn't the right place for reporting bugs against Xerces-J. Xerces-J 
has moved to JIRA for bug reporting. The StackOverflowError is a known 
limitation: http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/XERCESJ-206.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 6818 ***
Changed resolution to INVALID since duplicate bug has been deleted from Bugzilla and leaving as DUPLICATE creates referential integrity issues for the underlying database.
creator: markt@apache.org
